means: 提交( subject的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The functionalist model of industrial society was subjected to conceptual criticism.
sentence.Network_cn: 工业社会的实用主义模型在概念上遭到了批判。

sentence.Network_en: His family was subjected to a hideous attack by the gang.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的家人遭到了匪帮的恐怖袭击。

sentence.Network_en: They were jostled and subjected to a torrent of verbal abuse.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们被推来搡去，受到大肆的谩骂攻击。

entry.tran: 主题;题目;话题;题材;问题
entry.def: The subject of something such as a conversation, letter, or book is the thing that is being discussed or written about.

example.ex: It was I who first raised the subject of plastic surgery.
example.tran: 是我第一个提到整形手术这个话题的。

example.ex: ...the president's own views on the subject.
example.tran: 总统在此问题上的个人观点

entry.def: Someone or something that is the subject of criticism, study, or an investigation is being criticized, studied, or investigated.

example.ex: Over the past few years, some of the positions Mr. Meredith has adopted have made him the subject of criticism...
example.tran: 在过去的几年里，梅雷迪思先生所采取的某些立场使他成为了批评的对象。

example.ex: He's now the subject of an official inquiry.
example.tran: 他现在是官方调查的对象。

entry.tran: (知识、研究)领域;(尤指)学科，科目，课程
entry.def: A subject is an area of knowledge or study, especially one that you study at school, college, or university.

example.ex: Surprisingly, mathematics was voted their favourite subject.
example.tran: 令人惊讶的是，数学课被选为他们最喜欢的科目。

example.ex: ...a tutor in maths and science subjects.
example.tran: 辅导数学和理科课程的家教

entry.def: In an experiment or piece of research, the subject is the person or animal that is being tested or studied.

example.ex: 'White noise' was played into the subject's ears through headphones...
example.tran: 让受试者通过耳机听“白噪声”。

example.ex: Subjects in the study were asked to follow a modified diet.
example.tran: 要求研究对象按改进的食谱进食。

entry.tran: (艺术的)表现对象;绘画(或拍摄)题材
entry.def: An artist's subjects are the people, animals, or objects that he or she paints, models, or photographs.

example.ex: Her favourite subjects are shells spotted on beach walks.
example.tran: 她最喜爱的题材是那些在海边散步时发现的贝壳。

entry.def: In grammar, the subject of a clause is the noun group that refers to the person or thing that is doing the action expressed by the verb. For example, in 'My cat keeps catching birds', 'my cat' is the subject.

entry.tran: 可能受…影响的;易遭受…的
entry.def: To be subject to something means to be affected by it or to be likely to be affected by it.

example.ex: Prices may be subject to alteration...
example.tran: 价格可能会有所变动。

example.ex: In addition, interest on Treasury issues isn't subject to state and local income taxes.
example.tran: 另外，国债利息不需缴纳政府和地方所得税。

entry.def: If someone is subject to a particular set of rules or laws, they have to obey those rules or laws.

example.ex: The tribunal is unique because Mr Jones is not subject to the normal police discipline code.
example.tran: 因为琼斯先生不受一般的治安条例法规约束，所以专门设立了特别法庭。

example.ex: ...arguing that as a sovereign state it could not be subject to another country's laws.
example.tran: 争论说作为一个主权国家其不受其他国家法律的约束

entry.def: If you subject someone to something unpleasant, you make them experience it.

example.ex: ...the man who had subjected her to four years of beatings and abuse...
example.tran: 使她遭受了 4 年毒打和辱骂的男人

example.ex: Innocent civilians are being arrested and subjected to inhumane treatment.
example.tran: 无辜的平民正被逮捕并遭受非人的虐待。

entry.tran: (通常指君主制国家的)国民，臣民
entry.def: The people who live in or belong to a particular country, usually one ruled by a monarch, are the subjects of that monarch or country.

example.ex: ...his subjects regarded him as a great and wise monarch...
example.tran: 他的臣民把他视为伟大而英明的君主

example.ex: Roughly half of them are British subjects.
example.tran: 他们中大约有一半是英国国民。

entry.def: Subject peoples and countries are ruled or controlled by the government of another country.

example.ex: The subject peoples of her empire were anxious for their own independence.
example.tran: 她的帝国中被迫向她臣服的民族迫切渴望自身的独立。

example.ex: ...colonies and other subject territories.
example.tran: 殖民地和其他臣服的属地

entry.tran: (通常因为谈论的话题令人尴尬而)转换话题
entry.def: When someone involved in a conversation changes the subject, they start talking about something else, often because the previous subject was embarrassing.

example.ex: He tried to change the subject, but she wasn't to be put off.
example.tran: 他努力想换个话题，但她却兴趣正浓。

entry.def: If an event will take place subject to a condition, it will take place only if that thing happens.

example.ex: They denied a report that Egypt had agreed to a summit, subject to certain conditions.
example.tran: 他们否认了宣称埃及已同意在特定条件下参加峰会的报道。

auth_sentence.content: Next Bosch subjected the voles to a tail-suspension test.
auth_sentence.res_content: Next Bosch subjected the voles to a tail-suspension test.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Next Bosch subjected the voles to a tail-suspension test.

auth_sentence.content: He was then subjected to a lengthy sham trial.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was then subjected to a lengthy sham trial.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was then subjected to a lengthy sham trial.

auth_sentence.content: He was subjected to electroshocks to many body parts.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was subjected to electroshocks to many body parts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was subjected to electroshocks to many body parts.
